title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established within the Transportation Security Administration to advise on aviation security matters and develop recommendations for improvements. Working groups will develop recommendations approved by the Advisory Committee for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee for Aviation Security develops recommendations for improvements, which are approved by working groups and transmitted to the Assistant Secretary. The Committee submits periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations. Membership appointments are made within 180 days of enactment. The Advisory Committee for Aviation Security appoints members representing various organizations within 180 days of enactment. Membership includes individuals from air carriers, cargo air transportation, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security industry. The Assistant Secretary appoints members representing various organizations to the Advisory Committee for Aviation Security within 180 days of enactment. The committee includes individuals from transportation, indirect air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and the aviation technology security industry. The Assistant Secretary may remove a member for cause at any time and members shall not receive compensation. The Advisory Committee must meet at least semiannually and may convene additional meetings as necessary. Additionally, an air cargo security working group is established within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The Assistant Secretary appoints members to the Advisory Committee for Aviation Security within 180 days of enactment, representing various organizations. The committee includes individuals from transportation, air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and the aviation technology security industry. The Advisory Committee must meet at least semiannually and may convene additional meetings as necessary. An air cargo security working group is established within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues, including the implementation of air cargo security programs. The working group meets quarterly and submits recommendations to improve cargo security initiatives. The Advisory Committee for Aviation Security establishes a working group to provide recommendations on air cargo security initiatives and a general aviation working group to address transportation security issues for general aviation facilities and aircraft. The working groups meet regularly and submit recommendations to improve aviation security. The Assistant Secretary establishes a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues at general aviation and commercial service airports. The working group meets quarterly and submits information for inclusion in the annual report. The working group, part of the Advisory Committee, focuses on improving airport perimeter security and access control procedures at commercial and general aviation airports. It meets quarterly, includes experts in the field, and is cochaired by government and industry officials. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to this group. The Advisory Committee on Aviation Security, established under subsection (a), is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Definitions in this section include terms like "Advisory Committee," "annual report," "Assistant Secretary," and "perimeter security." Perimeter security involves monitoring and securing airport areas to prevent unauthorized access. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee was passed by the House of Representatives on June 28, 2012.
